turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: No onions though, okay?

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: No onions?

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: They make you fart.

turns.speaker: ANNABELLA
turns.text: Whatever it is, the answer's no, Eddie.  I'm too busy tonight.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Annie, I need a file.

turns.speaker: ANNABELLA
turns.text: Speak up.  Clear it with the Captain if you need a file.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: This is special, darlin'.  Please?

turns.speaker: ANNABELLA
turns.text: Just don't tell me you "owe me one."  What file?

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Double homicide.  A year ago. Las Halloween.

turns.speaker: ANNABELLA
turns.text: Don't thank me.  Your ass is already in enough trouble for this shit.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: I knew that.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Could be.

turns.speaker: ANNABELLA
turns.text: You gonna wind up working at a school crosswalk.   that doughnut's chocolate you, know.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Well, hello there...chocolate,

turns.speaker: ANNABELLA
turns.text: Don't thank me.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Thanks, babe.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: And I say I'm dead... and I move.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: No further.  I'm serious.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Are you nuts, walking into a gun?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You must listen carefully:  the Fire Department will be here soon. There is an injured man in the alley who needs assistance.  As Shelly Webster once needed your assistance, and as you are shortly going to need my assistance.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Listen:  Top Dollar.  He "owns the street here."  He will "erase my ass."

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: You don't say.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I know Top Dollar has turned your streets into his hell.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Fucking A, my friend.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: The others are called Skank, T- Bird.  Street names.  Funboy.  Watch me, office Albrecht.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: You, my friend, are dead.  I saw your body.  You got buried.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I saw it, too.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: You died, man.  I can't believe it but here you are.  Last year, you and your girlfriend --

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I need you to tell me what you remember.  What happened to us?

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: You went out the window.  She was beaten and raped.  She died in the hospital.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: You okay, man?  I mean, what just happened.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: The venom of bad memories.  You were there; you saw her.  I saw you seeing her.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: My name.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: I'm sorry as hell, man.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Thirty hours.  A day of life, plus change...

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Halloween is coming, soon.  You will have Top Dollar if you watch for me at the Showtime, tomorrow night.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: I should be trying to stop you.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Thank you.  For giving a damn.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: My pleasure. ERIC Don't smoke these.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: It's done. ALBRECHT I figured as much.  Did you cap off Funboy.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Funboy had to leave this mortal coil.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Yeah, among others.  Hey, man -- you're hit.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: It's only a flesh wound.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: It's only fourteen or fifteen flesh wounds.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I mean, I've done what I came to do.  It shouldn't hurt this much. But it will pass...

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Right.  You sure I can't just take you to the emergency ward?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: They couldn't do anything for me.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: How 'bout the morgue?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: No.  I have one more thing to do.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: You sorta looked like you might need my help.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: This isn't your place.  This isn't your fight.  And I don't need your help.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: You're welcome.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Leave here.  Don't do this.  I don't want you here.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: The hell you say.  This isn't just about you any more.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Don't interfere.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: You're bleeding, man.  You can't make it.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: Mom --?

turns.speaker: DARLA
turns.text: I told you you're not supposed to come in here.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: I lost my key.

turns.speaker: DARLA
turns.text: I was wonderin' where you'd gotten to --  Oh, Elly, honey, a cat.  Here?

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: He was a present.  Besides, we're moving anyway.  You said.

turns.speaker: DARLA
turns.text: We'll discuss this later. Obviously.  You left the door open.

turns.speaker: DARLA
turns.text: At least it finally stopped raining.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: It can't rain all the time.

turns.speaker: FUNBOY
turns.text: Hey, Darla -- before we die of old age, how about it --?

turns.speaker: DARLA
turns.text: Out.  Now.  I gotta work.

turns.speaker: FUNBOY
turns.text: Oh wow, oh wow, don't fucking do that, man.  I nearly had a fucking heart attack.

turns.speaker: DARLA
turns.text: Fun -- look at that guy...

turns.speaker: FUNBOY
turns.text: It's just the dope, don't worry

turns.speaker: DARLA
turns.text: Fun, he's not going away; he's scaring the piss outta me!

turns.speaker: FUNBOY
turns.text: Not me.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: You look like a rock star without a job.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I dabble.  May I?

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: My mom works over there.  I'm waiting for her, but she's probably with him, right now.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: Mister Funboy.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Mister Funboy lives there?

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: He has a room, upstairs.  I don't like him very much.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I can pick out a tune now and again.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: Can you play "Teddy Bears' Picnic?"  It used to be her favorite.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Does she have a name?

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: No name.  You sure ask a lot of questions.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: Do you feel okay.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: You gotta go now, I bet.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I have to go.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: What's going on...?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: A remembrance.  A closure.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You brought flowers.  As long as you don't forget her, Elly, she lives.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: She's dead.  She's gone.  And now you're just gonna go away and never come back, too.  I hate this place; it isn't fair.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Elly...

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: I remember him!  Here, Gabriel... here kitty... Gabriel... Is he still yours?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I think he's yours, now.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Shelly would've wanted you to have it.  This way, you'll think of her every time you see it...

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: And she'll be alive.  Up here.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: Now do you get to see her? Shelly, I mean.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: In a better place.  I hope.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: You're not gonna come back, are you?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I don't know if I can.  But you have this... and you know where to come.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: You mean you'll, like' dig your way out of the grave?  Euww.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: What's goin' on, Elly?

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: I went to see a friend of mine.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well, how's your friend?

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: She's still dead.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Chili dog for breakfast... it's original.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: Mom tried to cook.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: GRANGE
turns.text: I know your friend, too -- the one that looks like a rock star.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: I don't know you.

turns.speaker: GRANGE
turns.text: I'd like to get in touch with him.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: You're not a cop, either.  What do you want him for?

turns.speaker: GRANGE
turns.text: I'm looking for a good guitar man.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: You buying?  He kinda wanders around.  You'll see him if you pay attention.

turns.speaker: GRANGE
turns.text: I need to find him kind of soon, Elly.

turns.speaker: TIN-TIN
turns.text: Little early from trick-or-treat, homie.  This dick trying to bushwack me.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Murderer.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: A year ago.  Halloween.  A man and a woman.  In a loft.  You helped to murder them.

turns.speaker: TIN-TIN
turns.text: Last Halloween, eh?  Yeah...  Yeah, I remember.  I fucked her too, I think.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You cut her.  You raped her.  You watched!

turns.speaker: TIN-TIN
turns.text: Hey, I got my rocks off, so fuck you in the ass, man.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I want you to tell me a story, Tin-Tin.

turns.speaker: TIN-TIN
turns.text: I don't know you...

turns.speaker: TIN-TIN
turns.text: Holy shit... you're dead, man...

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Victims.  Aren't we all.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Top Dollar, you're the only one here still wasting good air...

turns.speaker: TOP DOLLAR
turns.text: Five large, in the drawer right over there.  I never saw you.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Do you know what you destroyed?

turns.speaker: TOP DOLLAR
turns.text: Take the dope, too.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: A year ago.  A very nice lady circulated a petition.  She died. Last Halloween.  Answer yes or no.

turns.speaker: TOP DOLLAR
turns.text: That's ancient history.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: It's yesterday!  Do you know what you destroyed?

turns.speaker: TOP DOLLAR
turns.text: Who gives a fuck!  I'm a businessman.  You gonna do me, then do me and shut you're face!

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You don't even remember...

turns.speaker: TOP DOLLAR
turns.text: I never forget anything, dickhead. That building was a sweep-and- clear; the bitch was a nuisance with her goddamned petition.  It got a little rowdy... end of story.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Rowdy.  Let me fill in some gaps for you.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Cute nickname, don't you think?

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: I ain't got no fuckin' ring.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Wrong answer.

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: Top Dollar.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Another jolly nickname?

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: You want those assholes, you want Top Dollar.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: T-Bird?

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: Like the car.  He hangs out with Skank. that little ass-hair, and they hang at the Pit -- hell, Funboy lives there.  Ask Top Dollar.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: A whole club of pirates, with pirate names...

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: I believe our friend Elly call you Mister Crow.  Please acknowledge; the mike will pick you up.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I can see her.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: Of course you can. ANGLE - GRANGE IN THE GALLERY --  in darkness.  The running lights on his night-scoped, laser-sighted sniper's rifle which THROWS vague sprays of eerie red and green light.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: I wish to possess what you have now.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I want the girl.  Unharmed.  Now.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: I know.  That is why I will prevail.  Mr. Grange... ?

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: Sooner or later, my action were destined to bring me a genuine Fury.  And it turned out to be you. At last.  I appreciate your abilities as few mortals can. That's why I desire them.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You're too late.  There was a guy outside - on the stairs - you really need to talk to.  But he turned to dust and blew away.  I don't have any power for you to take.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: I don't believe that. Lao motions to Grange with the killing blade.  Grange RELAXES his deathgrip on the crow.  MOVE IN CLOSE on Eric so we may perceive a palpable degree of relief.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: And how many lives have you destroyed?

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: I took yours from you.  Your little girlfriend?  I took hers, too.  Your meaningless, petty life?  I took it so that tonight your existence might gain a purpose.  You're no avenger. You're mine.

turns.speaker: FUNBOY
turns.text: How the hell did you do that?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Magic.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Neither.

turns.speaker: FUNBOY
turns.text: Yeah, I got a more fun idea myself.

turns.speaker: FUNBOY
turns.text: Owwwaaaa -- fuck me!  Look what you did to my sheets, you lame piece'a shit!  AAAAaa!  Goddd!

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Does it hurt?

turns.speaker: FUNBOY
turns.text: Does it hurt?!  You dead-ass, clown-faced fuck, of course it fucking hurts!  What the shit are you gonna do about this?!

turns.speaker: FUNBOY
turns.text: No, wait, no WAIT, that's too much, man, that's like overkill, nobody can take that much, you're wasting it -- !

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Your pain ends now.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: What the hell are you?

turns.speaker: SKULL COWBOY
turns.text: Interested?  Follow the crow.

turns.speaker: SKULL COWBOY
turns.text: Having fun yet?  No?  I'll give you a hint.  Remember whatshername?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Shelly?

turns.speaker: SKULL COWBOY
turns.text: Miss her?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SKULL COWBOY
turns.text: Kill the men who killed you both, and the Day of the Dead will be your reunion.

turns.speaker: SKULL COWBOY
turns.text: Get it?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Leave me alone -- !

turns.speaker: SKULL COWBOY
turns.text: Glad to see you're finally with the program.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Bugger off to the graveyard, skull- face, I'm busy.

turns.speaker: SKULL COWBOY
turns.text: You work for the dead.  Forget that, and you can forget it all.

turns.speaker: SKULL COWBOY
turns.text: Getting a little ambitious and extracurricular, aren't we?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Go away.

turns.speaker: SKULL COWBOY
turns.text: You need to learn to mind your own business or you'll never get where you think you're going.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: SKULL COWBOY
turns.text: Maybe I was wrong about you.

turns.speaker: SKULL COWBOY
turns.text: Your job is done.  You interfere with the living again.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Tell me I'll get hurt.  That I might die.  I've already done that.  I don't need anyone's help.  Yours included.

turns.speaker: SKULL COWBOY
turns.text: Do this thing and you will be vulnerable.  The blood will not return.  No powers.  No reunion.  Nothing.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Fine with me.

turns.speaker: SKULL COWBOY
turns.text: You'll be alone.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I'm already alone.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Don't waste my time.

turns.speaker: SKULL COWBOY
turns.text: Very well, it's your ass.

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: Blow yourself, bigmouth.

turns.speaker: T-BIRD
turns.text: Whoa, hey, whoa.  Business.

turns.speaker: T-BIRD
turns.text: Coupla more rings... 24k.

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: 18k.  Crap.

turns.speaker: T-BIRD
turns.text: ...necklace... pearls...

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: Nineteen bucks at Sears.  Fake,

turns.speaker: T-BIRD
turns.text: Leather purse...

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: What's this -- a little, ah, bloodstain, right?  Fifty bucks for the box, and I'm doin' you a --

turns.speaker: T-BIRD
turns.text: Yeah, I know, fatso.  Do us all a favor.  Make Top Dollar smile.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: Did you see an animal of any kind? Did you see a bird?

turns.speaker: GRANGE
turns.text: No.  I saw a guitar.  This isn't some rock-n-roller you forgot to pay, is it?  There was a drawing on the wall that looked like a bird.  In blood.

turns.speaker: GRANGE
turns.text: What... the hell is that?

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: This is a cobra, Mr. Grange.  Yes, it is real.

turns.speaker: GRANGE
turns.text: That thing is poisonous.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: Extremely so.  You and I are the recipients of unwanted good fortune, in the form of a man everyone is calling The Crow.

turns.speaker: GRANGE
turns.text: Give me a break.  That guy's a wacko...

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: I intend no slight to you, but I cannot find the English to adequately express just what he is.  I suppose Western mythology would describe him as a Fury.

turns.speaker: GRANGE
turns.text: Not a Plymouth Fury, I bet.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: Do you know of spirit assassins? You do know the dead can rise? Properly motivated, of course.

turns.speaker: GRANGE
turns.text: Like some sort of zombie on a revenge trip.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: Mmm.  But tonight I can take what is his.

turns.speaker: GRANGE
turns.text: Only thing you'll get from that clown is a faster way to die. LAO To the contrary...

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: Who is only invulnerable so long as he cares about the dead.  When he begins to care about the living, you'll find his heart can bleed... and I want it to bleed for me.

turns.speaker: GRANGE
turns.text: Kill a dead guy?

turns.speaker: GRANGE
turns.text: We've got company.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: Is he inside?

turns.speaker: GRANGE
turns.text: I've got him if you want him.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: No shooting.

turns.speaker: GRANGE
turns.text: Move in, guys.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: An unexpected pleasure.

turns.speaker: TOP DOLLAR
turns.text: Bad news.  Alot of action on the streets tonight, and nobody bothered to clear it with me.  Tin- Tin got himself whacked.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: Who got himself what?

turns.speaker: TOP DOLLAR
turns.text: One of mine.  And it wasn't a standard hit.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: I had heard something like this.  Describe it for me.  The "hit".

turns.speaker: TOP DOLLAR
turns.text: I was wondering if you could tell me anything... about a wildcat operative.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: I know of no one.  But even if there is, I am sure it is nothing outside your capacity to deal with?

turns.speaker: TOP DOLLAR
turns.text: Anybody violates my turf -- our turf -- I'll rip out there heart and show it to 'em.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: To be sure.  Now tell how your friend died.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: Sounds like our "Crow" is out-maneuvering you.

turns.speaker: TOP DOLLAR
turns.text: "Our" Crow...?

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: Come now.  You've seen the graffiti -- all over the city in the few hors it has taken your men to drop like plague victims. What about your turf, Top?  You don't seem to have ripped out anyone's heart yet.

turns.speaker: TOP DOLLAR
turns.text: The night is young.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: Do you think this childish machismo impresses me?  When I was a boy in Saigon I watched my country change one block at a time,  one building at a time.  Whole lives erased.  A way of life, polluted.  Today, no one forces me to move.  I use my powers to change your country, one block at a time,  one building at a time.

turns.speaker: TOP DOLLAR
turns.text: Nice speech.  What's it supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: Your comprehension is not required.  Your cooperation and, indeed, your ability are the issues on the table.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I'm Kathryn.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Annette Harrison.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Have we met?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Did you know Sebastian well?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You might say that.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Now I remember. Annette Harrison. Your father's the new headmaster at Oakwood.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I'm sure you're going to love it there.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I'll be fine.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Well, I'll leave you alone now. I just came in here to get something of mine.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Look, I know this sounds corny, but whenever I feel like I can't go on I...  turn to Jesus and he helps me through the problem. Call me an anachronism, but -

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Oh cut the shit, Kathryn.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You heard me.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Who the hell do you think you are coming into my house and saying those things to me. My brother is dead, have some respect.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Kathryn, I know all about you and Sebastian.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Sebastian was a pathological liar. I wouldn't believe a word he -

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I have his journal.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You what?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: His journal. He sent it to me the day before he died. Everything about you is in it. The blow jobs, the hand jobs, the menages, your bout with bulimia, the affair you had with your guidance counselor and how he gave you... eww. Let's see, then there's your coke problem... You still keep it in your crucifix, don't you? It's all in there.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You didn't show it to anybody?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Actually, I was planning on running down to Kinkos. Do you think you could give me ride?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You can't do this to me. It could ruin me.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: He told you he's failing in love with you? I've never known him to say those words before.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Really? I thought he said it all the time.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: That's not his style. one thing I can say about Valmont. He always speaks the truth.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Is there a mutual feeling between you two?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: No. I mean. I don't know.  What else do you know about him?

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Not a whole lot. We take some classes together. He's got a bad rep, but it's mostly bullshit.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Well, a lot of people are jealous cause he's loaded.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I don't know. I've been hearing some awful things about him.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: From who?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I can't tell you. I'm sworn to secrecy.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Annette, how long have we known each other?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Forever.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Now it's my job to look out for you. You're like a kid sister to me. Do I look like some kind of gossip queen?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You promise not to say anything?

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: On my mother's life.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Okay...

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: So what year are you going into?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Junior.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Got a boyfriend back home?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I don't know. Relationships seem too distracting. I'd rather concentrate on my studies.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You a lesbo?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Are you often this offensive on a first encounter?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I was just being honest. You happen to have a nice ass. Sorry.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I read your teen beat manifesto.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You did?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I must say I found it rather appalling.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: That's a first. Most people praised me for it.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Most people are morons. I mean who are you to knock what you've never experienced?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I wasn't knocking anything. It's just my belief that people shouldn't actually experience the act of love until they are in love and that people our age are too immature to be in touch with those emotions.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Oh really?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Take yourself. You've slept with several women. Are you happier because of it?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: How do you know I've been with several women?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: A friend wrote me.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Well maybe you should get to know the person before you judge them instead of listening to some bullshit gossip.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to upset you... but you still didn't answer the question.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Who the hell is taking the time to write letters, spreading this shit about me?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: It's not really important.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Fine, forget it. It's obvious that we're not going to be friends.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Why are you being so dramatic?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Look, I've got a lot of problems and I'm trying to deal with them and the last thing I need is people spreading shit about me.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Alright, I said I was sorry.  Can we start over again? I think we've gotten off on the wrong foot.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Excuse me. Excuse me!

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You talking to me?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Look, I know this is your house and all, but do you think you couid keep it down? I'm trying to read.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: What'cha reading?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: The Fountainhead.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Great book.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You've read The Fountainhead?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Several times. I'm not as dumb as I act, you know. When Howard Roark makes love to Dominique Francon... most romantic scene in all of literature.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Romantic? He rapes her.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: That's a matter of opinion.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You need help.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Why don't you come join me for a swim and we'll discuss it.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: At this hour? I don't think so.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Oh come on. Quit acting like a geriatric and get in the pool.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Gee, with an invitation like that how could a girl refuse.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Give me a minute. I'll be right down.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You know it amazes me that someone as bright as you can be so horrible.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: What? Another letter from your friend?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: This is my favorite part.  Even more treacherous and dangerous than he is charming and fascinating. He has never taken a single step or spoken a single word without some dishonorable or criminal intention. Every young girl he has successfully pursued has regretted it.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You know you could at least have the decency of telling me who's badmouthing me so I might have the opportunity to confront them face to face. How do you know it's not some girl who's pissed off at me for breaking up with her?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I sincerely doubt it.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Give me the fucking letter.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: The last thing I need is you going into my room searching for this while I'm away.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Is that the last thing you need? My your clever.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: How's the water?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Refreshing.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: About what you said today in the stable. I'm not a happy person.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I never said that.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You implied it.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Look, I didn't mean to give you a hard time.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: No, it's okay. I mean I look at you with all your morals and values and well, YOU seem to be happy in your choices. I envy you. No bullshit.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Seriously, you're amazing. You have everything going for you.  You're smart, you're beautiful, you're determined. You're everything I want in a girlfriend.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I wasn't kidding. I'd like to take you out.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Look, I'm flattered but, seriously it could never work.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Because you act like a pig.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Do you deny that there's an attraction between us?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I don't... I don't want to answer that... look we're friends.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You don't find me cute? Come on, look at these muscles.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I'm sorry, but you're not my type.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Fine. Friends it is. I can live with that.
